DLV
Class ODBCDirective

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--DLV.ODBCDirective
All Implemented Interfaces:
Directive
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExportDirective, ImportDirective
public abstract class ODBCDirective
extends java.lang.Object
implements Directive

This class represent an ODBCDirective. There are two types of directives, import and export.
With import you can import tuples (facts) from a database table.
With export you can export tuples in a database table from a predicate.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Francesco Ricca
See Also:
ImportDirective, ExportDirective

Constructor Detail

ODBCDirective

public ODBCDirective(java.lang.String databaseName,
                     java.lang.String userName,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     java.lang.String predicateName)
Build a new ODBCDirective.

Parameters:
databaseName - The name of a database, Ex. postgres.
userName - The username in the DBMS.
password - The password associated with "username".
predicateName - The name of the corresponding predicate.
